713609f-a.title: Manhattan: 52nd Street - 6th Avenue
713609f-a.text:
52nd Street, north side, west from Sixth Ave.
September 28, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

713612f-a.title: Manhattan: 52nd Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713612f-a.text:
West 52nd Street, east from (No. 115) a point between Seventh and Sixth Aves., showing the entrance to an automobile parking space on the south side of the street (right). Also shown is a pertion of the Sixth Ave. Wlevated
lLine.
March 30, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

713613f-a.title: Manhattan: 52nd Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713613f-a.text:
West 52nd Street, south side, between Sixth and Seventh Aves., showing an autoaobile parking space, as it extends southward to West 50th Street after crossing Westr51st Street. IIn the background appears, in silhouette, the Empire State Building, on the west side of Fifth Ave., from West 34th
to West 33rd Streets.
March 30, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

713608f-b.title: Manhattan: 52nd Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713608f-b.text:
WWest 52nd Street, east across Sixth Avenue, showing the well known 52nd Street restaurant and night club district. Adjacent to both Times Scuare and NockeSeller City, it provides intimate entertainment to the cafe society group. It is lodged in the row of former private residences that extend between Sixth and Fifth Avenue's and aro the direct result of the Prohibition era, being comparable to the Speakeasy of that day. Leon : Eddie's is the best known.
August 3, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

713606f-b.title: Manhattan: 52nd Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713606f-b.text:
(1)
61 to 69 West 52nd Street, adjoining, and at the N.E. corner of Sixth Ave., showing No. 61-67 as a cleared area after the demolition of a 5-story house, and No. 69 in the process of being dismantled. Also shown is a portion of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line and across it a 6-story house, at the N.W. corner of Sixth Ave., bearing Nos. 1301-D3
on the Avenue and 1O1 on West 52nd Street.
March 16, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date, and showing a more extensive view westward. No. 69, the 4-story building seen in view 1 is, at this time, completely demolished. Also shown (left to right) are Nos. 13O1 to 1313 Sixth Ave., west side, north from and including West 52nd, to
but not including West 53rd Streets.
June 9, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

713607f-c.title: Manhattan: 52nd Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713607f-c.text:
NTest 52nd Street, east from Sixth Avenue, as photographed during the subway constructional period on the latter thoNroughfare. The buildings at the N. E. corner were removed to permit tunnelling for the eastward curve to 53rd Street. The remaining former residences are now occupied by various restaurants and night clubs, and constitute a well known entertainment center for the cafe society group.
June 21, 1939
NNo's. 1-2-3
P. L. Sperr

713605f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 52nd Street (West)
713605f-a.text:
eew7
Sixth Avenue, waat side, north from W. 52nd to 53rd Streets, showing a clearance at the near corner. Under construction here is the underground bend in the 8th Avenue Subway. From this point it will run eastward under 53rd Street. Views 2 and 3 are limited to this feature. Overhead on the Avenue is the old "F5g" ltne. This will be torn down in 1938-9.
View 1,2: March 30, 1937
View 3: June 20, 1938
P. L. Sperr
